name: Amlodipine Besylate
indications: amlodipine besylate tablets calcium channel blocker may used alone combination antihypertensive antianginal agents treatment : hypertension ( 1.1 ) amlodipine besylate tablets indicated treatment hypertension , lower blood pressure . lowering blood pressure reduces risk fatal nonfatal cardiovascular events , primarily strokes myocardial infarctions . coronary artery disease ( 1.2 ) chronic stable angina vasospastic angina ( prinzmetal ’ variant angina ) angiographically documented coronary artery disease patients without heart failure ejection fraction < 40 %
contraindications: adult recommended starting dose : 5 mg daily maximum dose 10 mg daily . ( 2.1 ) small , fragile , elderly patients , patients hepatic insufficiency may started 2.5 mg daily . ( 2.1 ) pediatric starting dose : 2.5 mg 5 mg daily . ( 2.2 ) important limitation : doses excess 5 mg daily studied pediatric patients . ( 2.2 )
warningsAndPrecautions: 5 mg tablets amlodipine besylate tablets , usp 5 mg ( amlodipine besylate equivalent 5 mg amlodipine per tablet ) available oral white off-white , round unscored tablets , debossed “ c46 ” one side plain side . supplied follows : bottles 90 ( ndc 51407-950-90 ) bottles 1,000 ( ndc 51407-950-10 ) 10 mg tablets amlodipine besylate tablets , usp 10 mg ( amlodipine besylate equivalent 10 mg amlodipine per tablet ) available oral white off-white , round unscored tablets , debossed “ c47 ” one side plain side . supplied follows : bottles 90 ( ndc 51407-951-90 ) bottles 1,000 ( ndc 51407-951-10 ) storage store 20°c 25°c ( 68°f 77°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . protect light . dispense tight , light-resistant , child resistant containers ( usp ) . marketed : gsms , incorporated camarillo , ca 93012 usa manufactured : corepharma , llc . 215 wood ave , middlesex , nj 08846 revised : 02/2025 40356
adverseReactions: amlodipine besylate tablets contraindicated patients known sensitivity amlodipine besylate .
indications_original: Amlodipine besylate tablets is a calcium channel blocker and may be used alone or in combination with other antihypertensive and antianginal agents for the treatment of: Hypertension (1.1) Amlodipine besylate tablets are indicated for the treatment of hypertension, to lower blood pressure. Lowering blood pressure reduces the risk of fatal and nonfatal cardiovascular events, primarily strokes and myocardial infarctions. Coronary Artery Disease (1.2) Chronic Stable Angina Vasospastic Angina (Prinzmetal’s or Variant Angina) Angiographically Documented Coronary Artery Disease in patients without heart failure or an ejection fraction < 40%
contraindications_original: Adult recommended starting dose: 5 mg once daily with maximum dose 10 mg once daily. (2.1) Small, fragile, or elderly patients, or patients with hepatic insufficiency may be started on 2.5 mg once daily. (2.1) Pediatric starting dose: 2.5 mg to 5 mg once daily. (2.2) Important Limitation: Doses in excess of 5 mg daily have not been studied in pediatric patients. (2.2)
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
5 mg Tablets
                  
                  Amlodipine besylate tablets, USP 5 mg (amlodipine besylate equivalent to 5 mg of amlodipine per tablet) are available for oral administration as white to off-white, round unscored tablets, debossed with “C46” on one side and plain on other side. They are supplied as follows:
                  Bottles of 90 (NDC 51407-950-90)
                  Bottles of 1,000 (NDC 51407-950-10)
                  
                     10 mg Tablets
                  
                  Amlodipine besylate tablets, USP 10 mg (amlodipine besylate equivalent to 10 mg of amlodipine per tablet) are available for oral administration as white to off-white, round unscored tablets, debossed with “C47” on one side and plain on other side. They are supplied as follows:
                  Bottles of 90 (NDC 51407-951-90)
                  Bottles of 1,000 (NDC 51407-951-10)
                  
                     Storage
                  
                  Store at 20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
                  PROTECT FROM LIGHT.
                  Dispense in tight, light-resistant, child resistant containers (USP).
                  
                     Marketed by: GSMS, Incorporated Camarillo, CA 93012 USA
                  
                     Manufactured by: CorePharma, LLC. 215 Wood Ave, Middlesex, NJ 08846
                  Revised: 02/2025
                  40356
adverseReactions_original: Amlodipine besylate tablets are contraindicated in patients with known sensitivity to amlodipine besylate.
